header.title: A Rite of the Werewolf And the Infernal Witches Sabbat

central_thesis: The work presents a Left Hand Path system for self-initiation and astral transformation into lycanthropic and draconian forms, enabling travel to the Infernal Sabbat. It uses adversarial archetypes like Ahriman, Set, Seker, and Shaitan as catalysts for self-deification and the activation of the 'Black Flame' (isolate consciousness) through specific rituals, chants, and meditative visualization, drawing upon historical and mythological currents of witchcraft and sorcery.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Lycanthropy and the Infernal Sabbat
structure_content.summary: This section outlines the foundational prerequisites for astral travel to the Infernal Sabbat. It emphasizes the importance of prior self-initiation through 'A Ritual of Lycanthropy' and the successful visualization of one's 'werewolf shadow' or 'similar beast of sorcerer.' The core aim is to project the practitioner's 'Ka' (astral or Body of Light) into the adversarial realm of darkness, aligning with the pact of the Devil, the 'black man of the Sabbat.' Historical precedents, such as the legend of Pierre Bourgot, are cited to contextualize the transformational journey.

The text explores 'Transvection' as a powerful method for astral or dreaming projection. It delves into historical accounts of witches using psychoactive 'ointments' or 'salves,' often containing ingredients like nightshade, belladonna, and atropine, to induce sensations of flying and facilitate out-of-body experiences. While detailing traditional recipes and their effects, the author explicitly cautions against experimental use due to the highly toxic and potentially lethal nature of these substances. The discussion highlights how such ingredients historically contributed to mental and astral journeys to the Sabbat.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of the Witches Sabbat
structure_content.summary: The Infernal Sabbat is defined as an 'Antinomian self-love rite of sexual and psyche oriented self-deification,' leading to an 'Averse and more powerful state of being.' It is symbolized as the 'Persian Arezura' or 'Gates of Hell.' The Sabbat practice is described as illuminating the imagination, drawing the subconscious closer to the conscious, and facilitating self-knowledge. The author connects Sabbat traditions to historical lycanthropy practices, even drawing parallels to the meditative lycanthropy observed in certain Buddhist traditions, and positions the 'Black Mass' as a context for such transformations.

This section introduces key adversarial deities—Shaitan, Set, Seker, Ahriman, and Tiamat—as central figures for self-deification and initiation within a Left Hand Path framework. These entities are presented as 'God forms' or 'Masks of Dreaming,' embodying concepts of isolate intellect, self-imposed challenge, and the 'Adversary.' They are described as sources of 'Black Light' or 'Black Flame,' representing 'Fire and Perception of Being' and Antinomianism. The text contextualizes these figures within Islamic, Egyptian, and Persian lore, emphasizing their role in guiding the practitioner through a transformative journey towards mastery of self.

The operative aspect of lycanthropy is detailed as a two-tiered system. The first level involves intense, solitary imaginative visualization of a physical transformation into a werewolf, including specific physiological changes (e.g., skin turning ashen gray, eyes feral yellow, fangs, fur growth). The second, more advanced level entails a shift from human to wolf to an 'Ahrimanic Dragon form,' characterized by sharper teeth, horns, and a dark black-green scaled body. This draconian state signifies a profound 'self-transformative state' and 'deep communion' with Ahriman and Tiamat, enabling targeted astral journeys to 'Arezura' or 'Hell' (secret meeting places of witches).

Practical magical workings are provided to facilitate transformation and astral travel. These include instructions for meditative awakening using a 'bone or charm' and mental transformation through reversed prayers, such as 'The Toad Rite' (a backward rendition of the Lord's Prayer to raise a 'gray shadow'). The core of the practical system is conveyed through three explicit chants: 'The Chant of Becoming a Werewolf,' inspired by the Sloane Ms. British Museum, 'The Chant of the Infernal Sabbat,' which includes casting a circle as 'Kabed-us-spae,' and 'The Ensorcelment of Ahriman,' designed to summon and embody Ahrimanic forces.

The document specifies that this work was officially chartered by COVEN MALEFICIA of Houston, Texas, and the larger body of initiates, THE ORDER OF PHOSPHORUS. It provides publication details, including the issue date (July 9, 2003 e.v.) by Succubus Publishing, and lists contact information, including postal address, websites (http://algol.chaosmagic.com, http://www.botd.org), and an email address for those interested in further engagement with the associated currents and organizations. A list of further reading materials by the author is also provided.

key_concepts.definition: Within this system, Lycanthropy is a self-initiation ritual involving intense visualization and energetic projection of a 'werewolf shadow' or 'similar beast of sorcerer' to manifest transformation on astral or dreaming planes. It is a psychospiritual process extending to an 'Ahrimanic Dragon form' as a higher state of adversarial evolution.

Symbolized as the Persian Arezura or Gates of Hell, the Infernal Sabbat is a realm for astral travel and an 'Antinomian self-love rite of sexual and psyche oriented self-deification,' where the witch's 'Ka' or astral body journeys for self-knowledge and power.

The Ka refers to the astral body or spiritual essence of the practitioner. It is the subtle vehicle that is projected and intentionally drawn 'further into darkness' during Sabbat rituals and transformative practices to experience non-physical realities.

A powerful technique for astral or dreaming projection, often historically aided by 'ointments, made from nightshade and other herbs,' which were believed to produce a flying sensation and facilitate out-of-body experiences to reach the Sabbat.

This term, used in Witches Sabbat and Luciferian terminology, defines 'averse dreaming practice.' It represents the exploration of hidden, unconscious aspects of the self and reality, facilitating a deeper connection to adversarial currents and self-illumination.

These are adversarial God forms and archetypes utilized as models or 'masks of dreaming' for self-deification, isolation, and individual development within the Left Hand Path. They represent the 'Opposer,' 'Tester of self,' and sources of 'Black Light,' guiding the initiate through transformative challenges.

A central concept representing 'isolate consciousness and Being,' 'Fire and Perception of Being,' and Antinomianism. It signifies the spiritual illumination and gnosis derived from adversarial and infernal currents, leading to self-awareness and self-deification.

An ancient form of 'Persian Sorcery' or Witchcraft, integral to the 'Rite of Adversarial Shadow.' It involves 'developing a solitary of Spirit or Druj practice' and is the foundation for summoning Ahrimanic spirits and engaging with adversarial currents.

Referred to as 'my steed of infernal flight' and 'nightmare,' Kundak is a conceptual or energetic vehicle (a 'steed of wizards') used by the practitioner for astral travel to the Sabbat, often embodying shadow aspects of the self.

A technique involving focusing and projecting the 'psyche or self into the mask of the God form in question,' allowing the practitioner to assume the cloak of a specific deity (e.g., Set, Seker) during Sabbat experiences or astral workings for deeper identification and power.

An advanced state of self-transformation, evolving beyond the lycanthropic. The practitioner's form changes to 'dark black-green scaled,' signifying a profound 'self-transformative state' and 'deep communion' with Ahriman and Tiamat, embodying the 'Druj of darkness.'

A term indicating alignment with the Egyptian God SET or Set-an, considered an early form of Satan or Shaitan the Adversary. It denotes a specific Left Hand Path current focused on the principles and energies associated with Set.

A primal force described as 'the point of all hunger' and 'the crowning of the Beast,' closely associated with the Black Sun and Ahriman, representing a fundamental adversarial energy or spiritual locus.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented is an initiatory path of self-transformation via intense imaginative visualization and astral/dreaming projection, culminating in lycanthropic or draconian forms to facilitate travel to the Infernal Sabbat. It integrates historical occult practices, drawing heavily from Persian sorcery (Yatuk Dinoih) and adversarial currents (Set, Ahriman, Shaitan). The core objective is 'Adversarial Crystallization of the self,' strengthening the psyche and shadow, and embodying a chosen deity form through specific ritual chants, inverse prayers, and sustained meditative states. The system emphasizes an internal, self-directed process of becoming, aligning the practitioner with primal adversarial forces.
tools: Wolf skin belt or fake wolf fur (as a focal point for imagination)
Ointments (historically mentioned psychoactive herbs like nightshade, belladonna, atropine, bat blood; however, explicitly cautioned against due to toxicity)
Green candle with blue flame (mentioned in historical Sabbat context)
Designated bone or charm (activated through ritual practice)
Vessel of darkness (for 'The Ensorcelment of Ahriman')
rituals: Intensive Visualization of Ahrimanic Dragon Transformation
The Toad Rite (Reverse Lord's Prayer for 'gray shadow')
The Chant of Becoming a Werewolf
The Chant of the Infernal Sabbat (includes circle casting as 'Kabed-us-spae')

relevant_quotes.text: Once the sorcerer has undertaken the self-initiation ritual entitled, 'A Ritual of Lycanthropy'¹ in both parts, and he has visualized perfectly his werewolf shadow, or that similar beast of sorcerer, he has entered into the pact of the Devil, the black man of the Sabbat.
The Infernal Sabbat, being the Antinomian self-love rite of sexual and psyche oriented self-deification, allows the passing of the shadow of the witch into an Averse and more powerful state of being.

As a point of focus, the initiate who takes the flesh of the werewolf does so via the imagination... You must visualize your chosen form, how it looks and different stages of transformation and how you may hold them in certain points of shape changing, for various purposes.

This is the Ahrimanic Dragon form, a state of being in which the Witch has begun a self-transformative state into a deep communion with Ahriman and Tiamat – the Druj of darkness who by their isolation and individual beings, bring the gift of the black flame to those who seek to be like them.

The focus and intent of this ritual is the application of an ancient form of sorcery known as Yatuk Dinoih²⁵. The functional practice is defined as the body of the summoner encircling/ensorceling the nightmare (called Kundak – the steed of wizards) and shadow aspects of the self.

Lucifer is also a source of brilliance, a state of gnosis from which the sabbatic practitioner emerges. It is in this highest Empyrean¹³ realms of which Light is best experienced, the Air and Astral plane, from which all wind rushes about you like a tornado, where flame and sun envelopes your being and your Astral body is purified by flame.
The Black Light/Black Flame. This is defined as the Fire and Perception of Being, Antinomianism.

Set is noted for being a God which was different from all other Egyptian Gods. He was the Neter over storms, chaos and the darkness. Set, being a God of the North, was a sender of nightmares who was identical to the Greek daemon Typhon.
In the darkness is your light. Praise unto Ahriman, Horned lord of the kingdom of shades, specter and phantom, praise unto our kingdom of dead matter and flesh.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to contemporary Left Hand Path and Luciferian currents, particularly within Draconian and certain Chaos Magic traditions. It offers a structured and technically precise approach to self-initiation through intensive visualization, astral projection, and direct invocation/identification with adversarial archetypes. By synthesizing historical lycanthropy and Sabbat lore with Persian sorcery (Ahrimanic current) and Egyptian Setianism, it provides a unique framework for spiritual evolution and self-deification, moving beyond more traditional magical paradigms. Its emphasis is squarely on the operative side of magic for profound personal transformation, rather than external manipulation or exoteric spiritual alignment.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced practitioners and initiates of the Left Hand Path, Luciferianism, Setianism, and Draconian magic, especially those aligned with Michael W. Ford's specific currents (e.g., Black Order of the Dragon, Order of Phosphorus). It is suitable for individuals with a solid theoretical and practical background in astral projection, ritual work, and antinomian philosophy, who seek intense self-transformation, gnosis, and direct communion with adversarial spiritual forces. It is expressly not intended for beginners or those pursuing light-oriented or benevolent spiritual paths, due to its explicit focus on dark esotericism and adversarial currents.
